content: बंधः [बंध्-धञ्] {@--1@} A tie, bond (in general) (आशाबंध &c.). {@--2@} A hair-band, fillet; <ls>V. 4. 10</ls>; <ls>Ś. 1. 30.</ls> {@--3@} A chain, fetter. {@--4@} Fettering, confining, imprisoning, confinement, imprisonment; <ls>Ms. 8. 310.</ls> {@--5@} Catching, capturing, catching hold of; गजबंध <ls>R. 16. 2.</ls> {@--6@} ({%a%}) Forming, constructing, arranging; सर्गबंधो महाका व्यं <ls>S. D. 6.</ls> ({%b%}) Building, erecting. {@--7@} Feeling, conceiving, cherishing; हे राजानस्त्यजत सुकविप्रेमबंधे विरोधं <ls>Vikr. 18. 107</ls>; <ls>R. 6. 81.</ls> {@--8@} Connection, union, intercourse. {@--9@} Joining or folding together, combining: <ls>R. 14. 13</ls>; अंजलिबंध &c. {@--10@} A bandage, ligature. {@--11@} Agreement, harmony. {@--12@} Manifestation, display, exhibition; <ls>R. 18. 52.</ls> {@--13@} Bondage, confinement to this world (<ab>opp.</ab> मुक्ति which is ‘complete emancipation from the trammels of the world’); बंधं मोक्षं च या वेत्ति बुद्धिः सा पार्थ सात्त्विकी <ls>Bg. 18. 30</ls>; बंधान्मुक्त्यै ख लु मखमुखान्कुर्वते कर्मपाशान् <ls>Bv. 4. 21</ls>; <ls>R. 13. 58</ls>; <ls n="R.">18. 7.</ls> {@--14@} Result, consequence. {@--15@} A position, posture in general; आसनबंधधीरः <ls>R. 2. 6</ls>; <ls>Ku. 3. 45</ls>, <ls n="Ku. 3.">59.</ls> {@--16@} A particular position in sexual intercourse, or a particular mode of sexual enjoyment (these are said in <ls>Ratimañjarī</ls> to be 16, but other writers increase the number to 84). {@--17@} A border, frame-work. {@--18@} Arrangement of a stanza in a particular shape; {%<ab>e. g.</ab>%} खड्गबंध, पद्मबंध, मुरजबंध (vide <ls>K. P. 9.</ls> {%ad loc.%}). {@--19@} A sinew, tendon. {@--20@} The body. {@--21@} A deposit, pledge. {@--22@} An embankment, throwing a bridge across (a river). {@--23@} A disease in which the eyelids cannot be wholly closed.
